compounddef.title: SETPRINTLIMIT Set Limit For Printing Of Arrays

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Changes the limit on how many elements of an array are printed using either the disp function or using expressions on the command line without a semi-colon. The default is set to one thousand elements. You can increase or decrease this limit by calling setprintlimit(n) where n is the new limit to use.

sect1.title: Example
sect1.para: Setting a smaller print limit avoids pages of output when you forget the semicolon on an expression.

para.verbatim:
--> A = randn(512); --> setprintlimit(10) --> A
ans =
Columns 1 to 7
-0.2514 -0.1353 -1.3148 1.7915 -0.4740 -1.6836 -0.2605 -0.6206 -0.6711 -0.4389 Print limit has been reached. Use setprintlimit function to enable longer printouts --> setprintlimit(1000)
